This paper proposes a novel linear discriminant analysis algorithm based on mixed-integer programming, referred to as LDA-FP, to train on-chip classifiers that can be implemented with low-power fixed-point arithmetic with extremely small word length.

Download paper here

Citation: Hassan Albalawi, Yuanning Li, and Xin Li. “Computer-aided design of machine learning algorithm: Training fixed-point classifier for on-chip low-power implementation.” In Proceedings of the 51st Annual Design Automation Conference, pp. 1-6. ACM, 2014.
